A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This movie has broken my husband. I keep catching him staring into the middle distance sighing to himself or occasionally muttering "Oh Luke... why. Why.". 

He has even taken our children aside an explained to them at length the arc of Luke in the original trilogy\, how important its themes of love and faith and redemption were him as a young boy. And then with tears in his eyes explaining that Luke would never resemble the weirdo in The Last Jedi. He has then had to explain to our daughters that Rey is a terrible role model - a girl who doesn't have to work to achieve anything.

I've been instructed that we are not to buy any further Star Wars merchandise (this from a man who loves having lightsaber battles with our young son).

Honestly\, what have you done to my husband?!
